lines.text: [about Augustus]
Are you drinking because he nearly died or because he didn't?
Sarcastic aren't we this morning?
[On seeing your ex-spouse in secret]
You saw Julia's mother after your divorce.
Yes, but not in secret.
Well I don't remember being present...

[after committing an especially gruesome murder]
Aren't people awful?
[to the senate]
"STOP COMPLAINING AND GET MARRIED."
[Of Claudius's clumsiness]
That grandson of yours could wreck the empire just by strolling through it.
[On Marcellus' death]
It's not fair to accuse Livia of things without any proof.
Why shouldn't I? She accuses *ME* of things without proof.
[to Antonia]
Evil German woman. I'll burn your German house down.
[Regarding Augustus and his family]
That family is starting to sound like a Greek tragedy.

[on the wisdom of invading Britannia, i.e. Britain]
There's nothing of value there, and the people make very poor slaves.
[of Livia]
Between reading so many letters and arranging so many rapes, when does she ever sleep?
[on Claudius]
That child should have been exposed at birth.
[reciting a poem for the court]
The golden hair that Gala wears is hers/Who would have thought it?/She swears it's hers, and true she swears/For I know where she bought it!
[reciting another poem]
'Tis far away/And you are never there.
[Of the senate]
They won't allow me in because I am a woman, and they won't allow you in because you're a fool. That's strange, when you come to think of it, because it's filled with nothing but old women and fools.
